channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How safe is the food supply after federal cutbacks? Experts are worried
item.description: As the Trump administration slashes the federal workforce, experts say cuts to the USDA, FDA and CDC have left the food supply vulnerable to outbreaks...

item.title: An Ex-Employee, Mia, Testifies That Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Sexually Assaulted Her
item.description: “The highs were really high and the lows were really, really low,” the former personal assistant said. Mr. Combs has denied assaulting anyone.

item.title: The Times and Amazon Announce an A.I. Licensing Deal
item.description: In 2023, The Times sued OpenAI and Microsoft for copyright infringement. Now its editorial content will appear across Amazon platforms.

item.title: Chinese Students Are Frustrated With Trump’s Visa Bans: ‘What Now?’
item.description: As applicants in Beijing wait to see how sweeping the new action might be, one says the United States is making people too scared.

item.title: After Court Blocks Trump’s Tariffs, America’s Trading Partners Weigh Next Moves
item.description: President Trump’s threat to impose big charges — including 50 percent on the European Union — was in question after judges blocked his across-the-boar...

item.title: Supreme Court Curbs Scope of Environmental Reviews
item.description: The question for the justices was whether an agency had complied with a federal law by issuing a 3,600-page report on the impact of a proposed railway...

item.title: American doctors look to relocate to Canada to avoid the Trump administration
item.description: Canada has seen a surge of American doctors seeking to move north in the months since President Donald Trump returned to the White House.

item.title: President Trump expressing growing frustration with Russia's Vladimir Putin
item.description: For several days now, President Trump has expressed growing frustration with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the slow progress towards ending th...

item.title: Former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine discusses Trump's recent criticism of Putin
item.description: What does President Trump's changing rhetoric on Vladimir Putin suggest about his relationship with the Russian leader? NPR's Michel Martin asks Willi...

item.title: Federal court blocks Trump tariffs. And, why Hungary inspires American conservatives
item.description: The stakes are high in the case of a federal court blocking many of President Trump's tariffs this term. And, why Hungary and its leader are inspiring...

item.title: Uyghur Workers Are Moved to Factories Across China to Supply Global Brands
item.description: China’s persecution of Uyghurs prompted the U.S. to ban Xinjiang imports. China found a way around it — by shipping more Uyghurs across the country.

item.title: Chinese Students Are Frustrated With Trump’s Visa Bans: ‘What Now?’
item.description: As applicants in Beijing wait to see how sweeping the new action might be, one says the United States is making people too scared.

item.title: After Court Blocks Trump’s Tariffs, America’s Trading Partners Weigh Next Moves
item.description: President Trump’s threat to impose big charges — including 50 percent on the European Union — was in question after judges blocked his across-the-boar...

item.title: Israel Bombards Gaza Amid Chaos Surrounding Aid Handouts
item.description: Israeli attacks on Gaza have killed more than 60 people over the past day, according to local health officials.

item.title: How Uyghurs in China are Coerced to Work in Factories
item.description: The Chinese government is finding a way around the U.S. ban on imports from Xinjiang — by moving Uyghurs to jobs in factories outside the region. Davi...
